bioghist.p: William Nicholson Taylor (1882-1945) was a Quaker architect, businessman, and colonel in the army. He served in World War I and II. He was president of the American Chamber of Commerce in Paris and worked for the Du Pont Company in Paris. His wife was Gertrude de Brie. He was the son of Frank Hendrickson Taylor and Rebecca Nicholson Taylor.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the papers of William N. Taylor. Materials include: correspondence from Taylor to his mother, Rebecca Nicholson (1902-1930s); scrapbooks from Harvard and the Ecole des Beaux Art (1903-1917); an architectural notebook (1901-1902); correspondence from Taylor to his wife, Gertrude (1920s-1940s); letters of Rebecca Nicholson Taylor to her brother J. Whitall Nicholson and his wife Elizabeth Stokes Nicholson (1870s-1930s); a scrapbook kept by Rebecca N. Taylor about her children (1882-1893); the 1880 wedding certificate of Frank Hendrickson Taylor and Rebecca Nicholson; a genealogical chart of the Nicholson family (including Estaugh and Hopkins); family photographs and photos of Taylor's army regiment; and a small amount of printed material.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
